ï»¿OFFICIAL TF a DOCUMENTS, Administration Agreement for the Swedish Trust Fund for the Kariba Dam Rehabilitiation Project Trust Fund No. TF072313/Sida Contribution No. 51190092 Article 1 Subject and Amount of the Grant Section 1.01. In pursuance of the Single Donor Trust Funds Framework Agreement between Sweden, represented by the Swedish International Development Cooperation Agency, Sida ("Sweden") and the International Bank for Reconstruction and Development ("IBRD") and the International Development Association (the "IDA") (collectively the "Bank") dated March 17, 2011 (the "Framework Agreement"), I am pleased to inform you that Sweden will make available a grant (the " Grant") of two hundred million Swedish Kronor (SEK 200,000,000) to be administered by the Bank for the Kariba Dam Rehabilitation Project Trust Fund (Trust Fund No. TF0723 13). Section 1.02. The terms of the Framework Agreement shall apply to the Grant. The Bank shall administer the Grant in accordance with the provisions of the Framework Agreement, except as otherwise provided herein. Section 1.03. The Grant shall be used exclusively for the following activities: A. Bank-executed activities, for which the Bank has implementation responsibility: Technical assistance for an enhanced capacity program aimed at implementing the Hydropower Sustainability Assessment Protocol. B. Recipient-executed activities, for which one or more Recipients have implementation responsibility: (i) Refurbishment of the spillway control facility including the fabrication and installation of emergency gates and a new gantry, with refurbishment of associated built-in structure and replacement of secondary concrete; and (ii) The carrying out of a dam break analysis for the Zambezi River and of other studies, investigations, surveys, as well as the acquisition of equipment required. Such activities form part of the Project described in the Bank's Project Appraisal Document No. PAD 907. The Grant shall be used to finance the following categories of expenditure: A. For Bank-executed activities: (a) Associated Overheads (b) Consultant Fees for Individuals - with Indirect Costs (c) Consultant Fees for Firms (d) Contractual Services (e) Extended Term Consultants - with Indirect Costs (f) Media, Workshop, Conference and Meeting (g) Staff Costs - with Indirect Costs (h) Temporary Support Staff costs- with Indirect Costs (i) Travel Expenses
ï»¿B. For Recipient-executed activities: (a) Civil Works (b) Consulting (c) Goods (d) Operating Costs (e) Training Notwithstanding the foregoing, and so long as there is no change in the overall objectives or characteristics of the Grant, the Bank may reallocate the Grant funds between such categories of expenditure in accordance with the Bank's applicable policies and procedures on reallocation, without the need to obtain Sweden's approval for any such reallocation. Section 1.04. In addition to the financial reports on the Grant to be made available pursuant to Section 10.01 of the Framework Agreement, the Bank shall provide an annual narrative progress report on the activities financed by the Grant and a final narrative progress report on the activities following the Completion Date. Article 2 Payment Modalities Section 2.01. Sweden shall deposit the Grant funds with the Bank, upon request from the Bank, into such bank account designated by the Bank in accordance with the provisions of Section 6.02 of the Framework Agreement. The first installment of the Grant will be SEK50,000,000. Subsequent installments will be made in accordance with the provisions of Section 6.02(b) of the Framework Agreement and as follows: Year 2: SEK 50,000,000 Year 3: SEK 50,000,000 Year 4: SEK 50,000,000 The Grant is being provided in installments on the basis of financial needs of the Trust Fund, such that if the speed of the implementation of the activities to be financed by the Trust Fund makes it necessary either to bring installments forward or to delay them, the installments schedule shall be amended as agreed by the Bank and the Donor. Section 2.02. The Bank shall convert the Contribution funds into the holding currency of the Trust Fund, namely United States Dollars, promptly upon receipt of the Contribution funds and the Deposit Instruction containing the information specified in paragraph 4 at the exchange rate obtained by the Bank on the date of the conversion. Where the Contribution proves to be insufficient to complete the activities as a result of an exchange rate fluctuation, neither the Bank nor the Donor shall bear any responsibility for providing any additional financing. Article 3 Administrative Cost Recovery Section 3.01. In order to assist in the defrayment of the costs of administration and other expenses incurred by the Bank under this Agreement, the Bank may, following deposit of the Grant by Sweden, deduct from the total Grant and retain for the Bank's own account an amount equal to two percent (2 %) per Installment as an administrative fee for the Trust Fund, as stated in Article VIII in the Framework Agreement. In addition, costs for program management and nzy
ï»¿supervision up to a maximum of three percent (3%) will be charged to the trust fund on an actual basis. Article 4 Commencement and Completion Dates Section 4.01. The Grant funds may be used to finance expenditures for the Project commencing on the date of countersignature of this Agreement and ending on September 30, 2019. The Bank may make disbursements of the Grant funds for up to six (6) months after such latter date for expenditures incurred on or before such date, in accordance with the Bank's applicable policies and procedures. Article 5 Cancellation Section 5.01. Either party may, upon giving the other party three (3) months' prior written notice, cancel that part, if any, of the Grant funds provided under this Administration Agreement that the Bank has not committed prior to receipt of such notice under agreements entered into by the Bank with any third party, including any grant agreement. Article 6 Communications Section 6.01. The offices responsible for coordination of all matters related to this Administration Agreement are: For Sweden: David Wiking For the Bank: Marcus Wishart Head of Development Cooperation Senior Water Resources Specialist Embassy of Sweden, Lusaka Global Practice Water Tel: +260 211 251711 Tel: +27 (0)12 742 3147 Fax:+260 978 77 53 61 Fax: +27 (0)12 742 3134 E-mail: david.wiking@gov.se E-mail: mwishart@worldbank.orgThis Administration Agreement is drawn up in two originals, one for each party. It may be amended only by written agreement of the parties hereto.
